intro: Stisseria lanifera, commonly known as the woolly stisseria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
